metadata.synopsis: Dialogue with Zevlor after freeing him from his pod in the Colony Tadpoling Centre.
metadata.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/SCL_Main_A- Go to the Colony Tadpoling Centre (ReCon command "oe tc_teleport")- Interact with the mind flayer device that controls the pod.- Select the "Release" option.- killcombat- Talk to Zevlor.

43.speaker: Narrator
43.text: *Confusion crosses Zevlor's eyes as he takes you in.*

45.speaker: Zevlor
45.text: I thought I was done for... Thank you... Watching gods - the Blade of Frontiers? Wyll? What happened?

39.speaker: Player
39.text: I paid the price of angering the wrong devil.

41.speaker: Zevlor
41.text: And shouldered the cost to spare someone else a worse fate, I'd wager.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: I figured I was due a makeover. What do you think?

55.speaker: Zevlor
55.text: If I know you at all, you chose this fate to spare someone else a worse one. So I think it suits you.

56.speaker: Zevlor
56.text: Hells... I didn't think I was going to make it. Thank you...

35.speaker: Player
35.text: Hells... I didn't think I was going to make it. Thank you...

28.speaker: Zevlor
28.text: Hells... I didn't think I was going to make it. Thank you...

11.speaker: Zevlor
11.text: Watching gods - the Blade of Frontiers? Wyll? What happened?

5.speaker: Wyll
5.text: I paid the price of angering the wrong devil.
5.context: InternalNodeContext: |Needs appropriate flag checks for various fates of Tieflings.|

31.speaker: Zevlor
31.text: And shouldered the cost to spare someone else a worse fate, I'd wager.
31.context: InternalNodeContext: |Needs appropriate flag checks for various fates of Tieflings.|

9.speaker: Player
9.text: Finish what you came here to do - I daresay you've done enough for me.
9.context: InternalNodeContext: |Needs appropriate flag checks for various fates of Tieflings.|

48.speaker: Zevlor
48.text: Finish what you came here to do - I daresay you've done enough for me.
48.context: InternalNodeContext: |Needs appropriate flag checks for various fates of Tieflings.|

17.speaker: Zevlor
17.text: I... owe you an explanation. Much more than that. But first, please...
17.context: InternalNodeContext: |Needs appropriate flag checks for various fates of Tieflings.|

10.speaker: Zevlor
10.text: The others. The ambush - tell me they survived.
10.context: InternalNodeContext: |Needs appropriate flag checks for various fates of Tieflings.|

51.speaker: Player
51.text: You abandoned them. Do you really think you have the right to ask?
51.context: InternalNodeContext: |Needs appropriate flag checks for various fates of Tieflings.|

64.speaker: Zevlor
64.text: I do not. But if you know what happened... well, you deserve to know all of it.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: Some. Others ended up in a cell in Moonrise. That's on you.
37.context: InternalNodeContext: |Needs appropriate flag checks for various fates of Tieflings.|

25.speaker: Zevlor
25.text: Somehow, I suspect it's worse even than you imagine. Likely you heard that I broke, or froze, or some other lie kinder than the truth.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: The only survivors ended up in a cell in Moonrise.
24.context: InternalNodeContext: |Needs appropriate flag checks for various fates of Tieflings.|

60.speaker: Player
60.context: InternalNodeContext: |Needs appropriate flag checks for various fates of Tieflings.|

57.speaker: Player
57.text: They found refuge. But what the hells happened out there, Zevlor?
57.context: NodeContext: No heat or self-pity - just the clarity of his failure

1.speaker: Zevlor
1.text: You've heard some of it, I'm sure. That I froze, or broke, or some other lie that is kinder than the truth.
1.context: NodeContext: No heat or self-pity - just the clarity of his failure

62.speaker: Zevlor
62.text: We were ambushed by cultists, yes. And then I heard... Her. Their false god, whispering promises in my mind.
62.context: NodeContext: No heat or self-pity - just the clarity of his failure

19.speaker: Zevlor
19.text: I would be a paladin again - with a god's purpose, a god's power. Everything I needed to protect my people.
19.context: NodeContext: No heat or self-pity - just the clarity of his failure

18.speaker: Zevlor
18.text: And all the while, the cult tortured them. They fought, and ran, and died around me, while I imagined myself their saviour.
18.context: NodeContext: No heat or self-pity - just the clarity of his failure

16.speaker: Zevlor
16.text: By the time I regained my senses, it was too late. I did not just surrender to the Absolute. For a moment, I welcomed it.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: Be honest. You wanted the power, but not for any ideal - for yourself.

0.speaker: Zevlor
0.text: An ugly thought. With the echo of truth to it.

63.speaker: Player
63.text: If you wanted power, you never needed a god - only to live up to your ideal.

20.speaker: Zevlor
20.text: I fell short of that mark in Avernus - and even so, it was not so bad as this.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: 'For a moment' - until you realised your reward would be a tadpole.

40.speaker: Zevlor
40.text: Until I realised what I'd done. Perhaps I fought - I don't recall. Either way, I was deemed... unworthy of becoming a True Soul.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: It sounds like you were being enthralled. It's not your fault.

12.speaker: Zevlor
12.text: It would be nice to think so. But whatever these monsters twist us into... I believe it begins in us.

13.speaker: Zevlor
13.text: I won't make excuses. I can't make amends. But I know something of what you came to do - I want to help, if you'll let me.

26.speaker: Zevlor
26.text: Ketheric is below. He thinks you're no longer a menace. Descend and show him how wrong he is.

33.speaker: Zevlor
33.text: If there are any more survivors to be found, I'll find them - and lead them out of this place.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: I could use another blade in the fight to come.

44.speaker: Zevlor
44.text: Only if you can trust it won't be buried in your back. The Absolute swayed me once before. I won't risk it happening again.

30.speaker: Zevlor
30.text: Go, my friend. Please. Let me do this much.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: Find your own people. They need you.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: I don't care what you do - just get out of my sight.

2.speaker: Zevlor
2.text: As you wish. I'll pray for your success, to any god who will listen.

58.speaker: Zevlor
58.text: And you, my friend. And pathetic, inadequate as it is - thank you.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: Your people didn't need a paladin - they saved themselves.

21.speaker: Zevlor
21.text: They did? Oh sweet gods. I have no right to feel it - but I am proud of them.

3.speaker: Zevlor
3.text: The Blade of Frontiers. The saviour I needed, if not the one I deserved.
